answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that could be helpful in your Six Sigma training search.
The document below details the implementation and benefits of Six Sigma in Erie County, New York.
http://icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7554 
Additionally, the links below go to two other companies that specialize in Six Sigma training and studies. Both sites were recommended by an ICMA member on a similar question. The link below will bring you to that question and its responses. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20881
1-  http://www.isixsigma.com/
2-  http://asq.org/gov/2010/02/lean/lean-in-government-starter-kit-version-20.html?shl=095123
I hope these help with your training process.
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Steven Crowell
answers.text:
When I was with the City of North Port, Florida, the City instituted Lean/Green Six Sigma training for a group of selected employees through a local university (which conducted the training and certification at City Hall).  The "Green"designation was an environmental component added to the process.  The connection with a university might be an option to consider.  North Port might be a good source for the agreement, process, and implementation.

answers.author: Justin Brugger
answers.text:
When the City of Fort Wayne instituted its Six Sigma program in 2001, we signed a professional services agreement with a local resident who is a retired GE Master Black Belt, to provide in-house Six Sigma training to our employees.  I recommend issuing a RFI to see what resources are available within or near your community.   If you have any additional questions regarding Six Sigma, please feel free to contact me.  Good luck!

author: Angel Smith
text:
Good Morning, 
I am interested in good six sigma training options. Does anyone have suggestions? 
Thanks!
title: Six Sigma Training
